page.title: 11Bungy Barnes of Yarde
page.content: {Bungy Barnes}came to{farm in}Yarde in 1931 when he married Eileen. He had 160 acres which he farmed with two workers increasing to four, Bungy recalls that they were paid 30 shillings a week. It was a{mixed farm,}cattle, poultry, pigs, sheep and crops. At first the herd was a mixture but became just{Pedigree Shorthorns. Up until 1937 the milking was done by {hand, then electricity came to Yarde so electric equipment was used. The milk, in churns, was taken to the collecting point at{Withycombe,}to go on to{Minehead Dairy, first in the back of his car, then on a trailer and later by lorry. For the first two years on the farm Bungy was always up by 4.30.a.m. to deliver the milk between 6.00 and 7.00a.m.
